definition: to entrust a task to sb else
to enjoin/to implore/to urge
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.chinese: 记住卡罗尔神圣的嘱托。

sentences.english: Afterward, the Luo Beijing entrusts this reporter to convey him again to audience's thanks.
sentences.chinese: 之后，罗京再一次嘱托该记者转达他对观众的感谢。

sentences.english: In the teachers of entrust, we are very happy.
sentences.chinese: 在老师的嘱托下，我们很幸福。

sentences.english: He entrusted his children to a faithful friend.
sentences.chinese: 他把他的孩子嘱托给一位忠实的朋友照料。

definition: to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
to tell/to exhort/injunction
repeatedly urging/imploring over and over again
great trust
on leaving/on the point of departure
earnest/ardent (hope etc)
final wishes of the departed
on parting/facing separation
approaching one's end/with one foot in the grave
to instruct
ardent/eager/earnest
to entrust
the mission in life of a deceased person, left to others to carry on
to warn/to urge/to exhort/to give instructions carefully and insistently
on one's deathbed/at the point of death
to pass on/to communicate/to transmit
